Package com.github.actionfx.core.events

Class SimplePriorityAwareEventBus

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.actionfx.core.events.SimplePriorityAwareEventBus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PriorityAwareEventBus
    public class SimplePriorityAwareEventBus
extends java.lang.Object
implements PriorityAwareEventBus
    Straight forward implementation of the PriorityAwareEventBus implementation that considers a priority assigned to a registered subscriber, when publishing an event to its subscriber.

    Please note that this class does not implement any sophisticated publish/subscribe strategies like backpressure, etc. as this is not required for inter-controller eventing as of the moment.

    Furthermore, asynchronous invocations need to be implemented in the provided Consumer itself and is not provided by this event bus implementation.

    Author:
    koster

        public void publish​(java.lang.Object event,
                    java.util.function.Consumer<java.lang.Exception> exceptionCallback)
        Description copied from interface: PriorityAwareEventBus
        Publish the given event to subscribed listener. In case an exception occurs while calling the subscribed listener, the given exceptionCallback is invoked.
        Specified by:

      • subscribe

        public <T> void subscribe​(java.lang.Class<T> eventType,
                          java.util.function.Consumer<? super T> eventConsumer,
                          int priority)
        Description copied from interface: PriorityAwareEventBus
        Subscribes the given eventConsumer to events of type eventType.
        Specified by:
        subscribe in interface PriorityAwareEventBus
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type descriptor
        Parameters:
        eventType - the event type
        eventConsumer - the event consumer when events of type eventType are published.
        priority - the priority of the given eventConsumer. A consumer with a lower value for priority will be notified on publications before consumer with a higher priority value.
